item.title: Custom Npcs
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

ohhider

Hahah, anyways you would be best off doing this (I think)

[code]f(i == 1597){
class5.aStringArray66 = new String[3];
class5.aStringArray66[2] = “Talk to”;
class5.aStringArray66[1] = “Trade”;

class5.anIntArray76 = new int[0];
class5.anIntArray70 = new int[0];

class5.anIntArray94[1] = 2; // npc

class5.aString65 = “blah”;
class5.aByteArray89 = “A”.getBytes();
}
[/code]

I’m guessing the int on 66 determines the line in which the text is displayed.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Npcs
item.dc:creator: @sheeba sheeba
item.description:
@sheeba wrote:

I added a custom npc and I want to to just have talk to and trade.

class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack";

i see that 1 is attack, 2 is trade and idk what is 3. But what would I put to make it so that if i hit talk it would talk like before but i got the trade right.

if(i == 1597){
class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
class5.aStringArray66[3] = “Talk to”;
class5.aStringArray66[2] = “Trade”;

class5.anIntArray76 = new int[0];
class5.anIntArray70 = new int[0];


class5.anIntArray94[1] = 2; // npc

class5.aString65 = "blah";
class5.aByteArray89 = "A".getBytes();
}

Read full topic
